 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 1.3 - ADAPTABLE
MEANINGFUL SEQUENCE(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

When the sequence in which content is presented affects its meaning, a correct
reading sequence can be programmatically determined. 

These websites...

Create content that can be presented in different ways (for example simpler
layout) without losing information or structure.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
Example 1: In a multi-column document, the linear presentation of the content
flows from the top of a column to the bottom of the column, then to the top of
the next column. I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/meaningful-sequence.html#examples] 
Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
